intro: Velpeaulia alibrexioides, commonly known as the Brazilian peppertree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are edible but have a peppery taste. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types and light conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive.
